file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-23-08-04 - ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the LH and RH escape-hatch trim shroud assemblies. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM SHROUD - RE- ALL 25-23-08-000-801-A MOVAL ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM SHROUD - IN- ALL 25-23-08-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-23-08 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-23-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM SHROUD - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the LH and RH escape-hatch trim shroud assemblies. (2) The LH and RH escape-hatch trim shroud assemblies are installed in the passenger cabin, around the escape hatches, at zones 251 and 252. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 52-21-00-000-801-A/400 PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the passenger seats (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400), as applicable. (2) Remove the LH and/or RH passenger-cabin escape hatch ( AMM TASK 52-21-00-000-801-A/400), as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Remove the escape-hatch trim shroud assembly (1) as follows: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-23-08 Page 2 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: The procedure below must be used to remove the LH or RH escape-hatch trim shroud assemblies. (a) Pull down and remove the trim strips (6). NOTE: If necessary, you can use a pin in the hole (2) to help you pull down the trim strip (6). (b) Remove the screws (3) and washers (4). (c) Remove the screws (8) and washers (7). (d) Remove the screws (9) and washers (10). (e) Lightly move the escape-hatch trim shroud assembly (1) and disconnect the electrical connectors (5) and (11). (f) Remove the escape-hatch trim shroud assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-23-08 Page 3 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Escape-Hatch Trim Shroud Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 401 3. SCREW (4) DET. B 4. WASHER (4) 2. HOLE 7. WASHER (2) A A ZONE ZONE 251 252 8. SCREW (2) 1 1. ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM DET. C SHROUD ASSEMBLY B 5. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 6. TRIM STRIP (2) C DET. A ROTATED 9. SCREW (2) 10. WASHER (2) D DET. D 1 LEFT SIDE SHOWN 11. ELECTRICAL RIGHT SIDE HANDED CONNECTOR 145AMM250245.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-23-08 Page 4 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-23-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM SHROUD - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the LH and RH escape-hatch trim shroud assemblies. (2) The LH and RH escape-hatch trim shroud assemblies are installed in the passenger cabin, around the escape hatches, at zones 251 and 252. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400 - PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - INSTAL- AMM TASK 52-21-00-400-801-A/400 LATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Install the escape-hatch trim shroud assembly (1) as follows: NOTE: The procedure below must be used to install the LH or RH escape-hatch trim shroud assemblies. (a) Put the escape-hatch trim shroud assembly (1) in its installation position. (b) Connect the electrical connectors (5) and (11). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-23-08 Page 5 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) Attach the escape-hatch trim shroud assembly with the screws (9) and washers (10). (d) Attach the escape-hatch trim shroud assembly with the screws (8) and washers (7). (e) Attach the escape-hatch trim shroud assembly with the screws (3) and washers (4). (f) Push the trim strips (6) up to their installation position. NOTE: If necessary, you can use a pin in the hole (2) to help you push the trim strips (2) up. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Install the removed passenger-cabin escape hatches ( AMM TASK 52-21-00-400-801- A/400). (2) Install the removed passenger seats (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-23-08 Page 6 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
